parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
Hello, you must be Lord Haffenden and his brother Lord Cedric? \|\|\^
Yes, I am. I want to know what is going on in Haffenden? \|\|\^
It’s beautiful, isn’t it? The people have fully devoted themselves to - \|\|\^
- the gods. They have aligned themselves with what really matters. \|\|\^
That doesn’t explain why they seem to be against our family? \|\|\^
That’s simple, they no longer see you as their superiors. Nobles are - \|\|\^
- no better than the commoners in the eyes of the gods as they should be. - \|\|\^
- Although I think the fact your family fled as the princes' armies sacked - \|\|\^
- the city. It emphasised how distant you are from the commoners. \|\|\^
We don’t think we’re better than the commoners however I can see this - \|\|\^
- lie you have spread gaining traction with the commoners. But as people - \|\|\^
- of the faith, how can you be so calm with our enemies? \|\|\^
The Princes of Rinsar were our enemies don’t be fooled. They were too - \|\|\^
- busy fighting wars so encouraged us to do what’s right and spread the - \|\|\^
Well, thank you for giving the people hope in these troubled times. But - \|\|\^
- we are coming back. So we will need you to let people know of the - \|\|\^
- things we have done to get our home back. \|\|\^
I’m afraid I can’t do that. The people would resort to their old ways. You’re - \|\|\^
- welcome to come back to the new Kingdom of Lamar and follow the new laws - \|\|\^
- like everyone else. Your castle is and will always be yours plus you - \|\|\^
- would set an example for commoners. However, Haffenden will be governed - \|\|\^
- by the faithful as it should be. \|\|\^
You’re delusional. Haffenden is our home and will always belong to - \|\|\^
- the Haffendens. That includes ruling it. We’re not going to bow or - \|\|\^
- accept the demands of a Charleton masking himself as a religious zealot. - \|\|\^
- I don’t know what you have done to turn the commoners against my family - \|\|\^
- or to seize power in Haffenden, frankly, I don’t care. I am Lord Haffenden, - \|\|\^
- now I am telling you to turn the people back to our favour by letting - \|\|\^
- them know we haven’t abandoned them we have been fighting this war - \|\|\^
- elsewhere. We have removed the princes' armies from Haffenden along - \|\|\^
Lord Haffenden you are, but like I said the faithful will lead from now on. \|\|\^
No. If you can’t do what I have asked then there is no need for you - \|\|\^
- Your so-called faith couldn’t even protect the people that stood as an - \|\|\^
- example to the common people. Where were the gods when my parents were slain? - \|\|\^
Men gather round. They can’t be allowed to stop the progress we have made. \|\|\^
You obtained Priest Mansel's Entry in the Journal.

Okay, okay, I get it. You are Lord Haffenden. You are in charge. We will - \|\|\^
- do what you ask. We will spread the message. Just spare my men of faith. \|\|\^
Very well. I will be going to end this war so I need you to fix things for - \|\|\^
- when I come back. Cedric, I’ll be at the city gate when you’re ready to go. \|\|\^

Welcome back Lord Cedric, I see you have brought King Dormato of the - \|\|\^
- Kingdom of Luthania with you. How can I help you? \|\|\^
Weren’t you told to fix things in Haffenden by my brother who is the - \|\|\^
I have fixed things, I have put Haffenden on the path of the righteous. - \|\|\^
- It's a path we all must follow even a lord like you Lord Cedric. Your brother - \|\|\^
- meant to stop the progress the faithful have made. I will not allow that, - \|\|\^
You are not Lord of Haffenden. That’s not your choice to make. \|\|\^
Neither is it your brothers. It is the gods choice. Besides since you've been gone - \|\|\^
- I have put measures in place to ensure the faithful have control in - \|\|\^
- Haffenden to ensure the gods plan is fulfilled. You cannot stop us. I offer you the - \|\|\^
- same opportunity like before you are welcome to join the new Haffenden. \|\|\^
What is this nonsense? I don’t recognise your authority, you are no Lord! \|\|\^
Nor do we recognise yours you are no king here. I know that maps and borders - \|\|\^
- are always changing so I understand the confusion. \|\|\^
You are to end this now! My brother warned you what would happen if you crossed - \|\|\^
We will not be moved Lord Cedric. I don’t know how many times I must stress - \|\|\^
- this point are we going to have a problem? \|\|\^
Priest Mansel's entry in the Journal was updated.
